intro: Satureja subspicata var. blavii, commonly known as Blavii savory, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, characterized by its square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with small, tubular flowers that bloom in shades of pink to purple. Its leaves are fragrant and often used in traditional medicine and culinary applications. The variety is distinguished by its compact growth habit and unique floral structure compared to other satureja species.
